results.title: Brilliant gardens
results.creator_credit: Nigel Farrell, Botanical Gardens Conservation International and Tadpole Lane
results.brief_description: Let Rula Lenska lead you on a magical journey through 8 beautiful botanic gardens in Britain from places such as Kew, Edinburgh, Cambridge, Chelsea, Westonbirt, Glasgow, Ness and Wisley. The individual, and often international species found in each garden are explored, as well as what they say about the social, political and horticultural tendencies of the country.

results.title: Bridget Jones's diary [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sharon Maguire, Debra Hayward, Liza Chasin, Little Bird Ltd, Studio Canal and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: Bridget Jones (Renee Zellweger) is 32, single, smokes too much, drinks too much, and says what is on her mind. After another disastrous New Years Eve, Bridget makes a resolution to keep a diary, lose weight, cut down on her smoking and drinking, and above all, find herself the perfect man. Her mother tries to assist her in her search for a man, setting her up with Mark Darcy (Colin Firth, in a role comparable to his performance as Mr. Darcy in ‘Pride and Prejudice’), the son of an old family friend. Unfortunately, the first man to notice the new Bridget is her boss, Daniel Cleaver (Hugh Grant), a chauvinistic womaniser with whom she starts a love affair, despite her attraction to Mark. Bridget’s confusion over her attraction to Mark, her relationship with Daniel, is complicated by her meddling and slightly eccentric friends, and the breakdown of her parent’s relationship. Based on the novel by Helen Fielding. Cast also includes Gemma Jones, Celia Imrie, Hugh Grant and Jim Broadbent.

results.title: Bridge over the Bosporus
results.creator_credit: Michael Bennett and Turner Film Productions
results.brief_description: A record of the building of the bridge across the Bosporus which divides the city of Istanbul. The bridge was opened in October 1973. Narrated by John Carson.

results.title: Brideshead revisited. Pt. 1 [episodes 1-5]
results.creator_credit: Charles Sturridge, Derek Granger and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: This tape comprises of episodes one to five - the first half of the magnificent series set during World War II. It is dawn on a cold winter’s morning in 1943. Charles Ryder, painter turned army captain, in the twilight of World War II has marched most of the night and camped with his platoon at their secret destination. On waking, he is amazed to find he is at the rear of Brideshead Castle where he spent many years of enchantment and grief in his youth, and which, years ago he had left vowing never to return. Now here he was again, cold and with memories flooding over him like storm-surf on the shore. He was back. Brideshead revisited had begun. Cast includes Jeremy Irons, Anthony Andrews, Diana Quick, Laurence Olivier, Claire Bloom and John Gielgud. Adapted from the novel by Evelyn Waugh.

results.title: Bricklaying : it's easier than you think
results.brief_description: This video is designed to teach the inexperienced handy person to completely undertake the building of simple brick structures. It emphasises the importance of using the correct tools and materials and demonstrates the methods and techniques employed by bricklayers to achieve good results for basic brick constructions.

results.title: Brief city: the story of London's festival buildings
results.creator_credit: Jacques Brunius, Maurice Harvey, Richard Massingham and Massingham Productions
results.brief_description: A tour of inspection of the Festival of Britain South Bank Exhibition photographed during the last ten days of the Exhibition. Emphasis is placed on the architecture of the Exhibition, explaining why it was planned as a “giant toyshop”, why it was given no processional vista, and how the Exhibition was regarded as an experiment in modern building and architecture.
results.title_for_label: Brief city: the story of London’s festival buildings

results.title: Bridging the centuries
results.creator_credit: John Patterson Reid, Royal Doulton and World Wide
results.brief_description: Traces the history of pottery making in Britain from neolithic times to the present day. Examples of rare English pottery and china from different centuries are shown. Illustrates the influence of Chinese work on the development of English bone china. Describes the evolution of English translucent china particularly for tableware.

results.title: Bridges
results.creator_credit: David Hughes and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A simply stated stimulus film on bridges. Shows children making bridges, asking questions and talking about bridges. Shots of historic bridges and bridges of Melbourne are interspersed throughout. Suitable for primary years prep-6.

results.title: Brides of Christ (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Sue Masters and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A six hour mini-series based on the lives of Sr. Catherine and Sr. Paul who enter the convent in the early 50’s. Behind high convent walls, their lives are circumscribed by centuries old traditions, rites and disciplines, yet they must become part of a changing world. For many, their faith will be sufficient to carry them through their personal crisis. In their care are spirited teenagers, schooled in the old creed, yet eager to taste the new freedoms. Starring Brenda Fricker, Sandy Gore, Josephine Byrnes, Lisa Hensley, Naomi Watts and Kym Wilson.
